英文法規名稱: Regulations Governing Payments for Expenses for Laboratory Testing, Prevention and Treatment of HIV
中文法規名稱: 人類免疫缺乏病毒感染者治療費用補助辦法
沿革內容:
1.Formulated and announced in 11 articles by the Department of Health, the Executive Yuan, on June 16, 2008, under Shu-Shou-Chi Order No. 0970000464
2.Amended Article 3 and Article 8 and announced by the Department of Health, the Executive Yuan, on October 22, 2009, under Shu-Shou-Chi Order No. 0980001449
3.Amended Article 8 and announced by the Ministry of Health and Welfare on May 26, 2014, under Bu-Shou-Chi Order No. 1030100702

法規內容.條文內容: This set of Regulations is formulated in accordance with regulations of Paragraph 2, Article 6, and Paragraph 3, Article 16 of the HIV Infection Control and Patient Rights Protection Act (hereafter referred to as the Act).

For those individuals that payments are to be made under Subparagraph 1 of the preceding Article, the central competent authority shall issue them national medical care service cards (hereafter referred to as the Service Card); for individuals that payments are to be made under Subparagraph 6 of the preceding Article, the competent authority may also issue them the Service Card.
The Service Card of the preceding Paragraph is issued in two types, Certification Card and Provisional Card.  Their issuance and validity period are as follows.
1. Certification Card: for individuals meeting regulations of Items 1 through 3 of Subparagraph 1 of the preceding Article, the Card is valid until the infected are deceased.
2. Provisional Card:
(1)Individuals meeting regulations of Item 4 of Subparagraph 1 of the preceding Article, the Card is valid until the residence period specified in the residence certificate of the Taiwan Area at the time of application;
(2)Individuals meeting regulations of Item 5 of Subparagraph 1 of the preceding Article, the Card is valid until the termination of the current pregnancy at the time of application;
(3)Individuals meeting regulations of Subparagraph 6 of the preceding Article, the validity of the Card is three months in principle; for special needs, application for extension may be made to the competent authorities prior to the expiration of the validity.

The infected, when accepting laboratory testing or medical care at designated medical institutions, shall present for examination the following documents:
1. National Identification Card, valid residence certificate, or other documents sufficient to prove their identity;
2. The Service Card.
Designated medical institutions, in checking the qualification documents of the preceding Paragraph, when ascertain that the documents are either expired or are not in compliance with regulations of this set of Regulations, shall not accept them for processing.

The central competent authority may commission the National Health Insurance Administration to process the application, review and payment of the expenses regulated in this set of Regulations.  Procedures for application by the designated medical institutions may follow relevant regulations of the National Health Insurance.
Funds for this set of Regulations shall be paid from annual budget prepared by the central competent authority.
This set of Regulations shall be implemented on the day of announcement.
